title: Half of First Trust branches to close in 2017
text:
First Trust Bank is to close 15 branches in Northern Ireland in 2017.
The bank says the move, which will half the number of branches, was a “difficult decision” however it follows a forty percent decline in bank usage since 2010.
It insists it will work hard to minimise the impact on staff and customers.
As well as the region-wide closures, the bank has announced a £10 million investment strategy for personal and business customers. Five new specialist business centres will be created the Ballymena, Dungannon, Enniskillen, Londonderry and Newry branches.
The bank, which is part of the AIB group, has also agreed a partnership with the Post Office to enable customers to conduct their everyday banking transactions.
Affected customers will receive letters in advance to tell them how to use alternative branches, services and transactions at the Post Office.
Head of First Trust Bank, Des Moore said: “Due to changing customer behaviours and trends and in particular the sizable shift from branch usage towards digital banking, First Trust Bank has undertaken an 18-month strategic review to plan how we best serve the needs of customers now and in the future. This included a review of all our customer service points including our branch network, with a view to reshaping for an efficient, effective and sustainable business.
“Since 2010 we have seen almost a 40% decline in branch usage coupled with a 117% increase in mobile transactions over the past two years and we have had to make the difficult decision to close a number of branches. We will be working hard to minimise the impact on the customers and staff concerned.”
The branches to close are as follows
Antrim - 7th July Andersonstown - 7th July Armagh - 7th July Banbridge - 4th August Cookstown - 30th June Crescent Link, Derry / Londonderry - 7th July Downpatrick - 28th July High Street, Belfast - 4th August Knock (Upper Newtownards Road) - 28th July# Magherafelt - 28th July Newtownards - 30th June Ormeau Road, Belfast - 30th June Portadown - 4th August Strabane - 28th July Warrenpoint - 30th June Last updated Thu 23 Feb 2017 Business Northern Ireland Belfast
